info.name: CredBuzz Backend API
info.description:
Complete API collection for CredBuzz Backend including User Authentication, RBAC (Role-Based Access Control), and KYC Verification endpoints.

## Registration Flow (NEW)
1. Register with first_name, middle_name, last_name, email, phone_number, password
2. Verify Email OTP
3. Verify Phone OTP
4. Login (END_USER requires verified email & phone)

## Dynamic Login
Login uses a single `identifier` field that auto-detects:
- **Email**: Contains @ (e.g., user@example.com)
- **Phone**: Starts with + (e.g., +1234567890)
- **User Code**: 6 alphanumeric chars (e.g., CGX0R0)
- **Username**: Default fallback

## Login Security
- Progressive lockout: 5 attempts ‚Üí 2min ‚Üí 5min ‚Üí 10min ‚Üí 30min ‚Üí 60min ‚Üí blocked
- Session inactivity timeout: 30 minutes (like bank apps)
- JWT includes: user_code, user_role, app_access, feature_access
- END_USER must verify email AND phone before login

## User Roles
- **DEVELOPER**: System developer (highest privilege) - Created via CLI
- **SUPER_ADMIN**: Super administrator - Created via CLI with Developer authorization
- **ADMIN**: Administrator - Register + role assignment by Super Admin
- **CLIENT**: Client user - Register + role assignment by Admin+
- **END_USER**: End user (default) - Self-registration

## KYC Flow
1. Start KYC ‚Üí 2. Aadhaar Details ‚Üí 3. Aadhaar Images ‚Üí 4. PAN Details ‚Üí 5. PAN Image ‚Üí 6. Business Details ‚Üí 7. Verification Images ‚Üí 8. Bank Details ‚Üí 9. Submit for Review

## KYC Security
- Aadhaar, PAN, Bank Account numbers are encrypted
- Masked in responses (XXXX-XXXX-9012)
- Max file size: 5MB

## New Features
- User Activity Logs
- Full Profile API with KYC Status
- Access Management APIs (assign/revoke access)

Login as Developer using dynamic identifier. Response includes app_access and feature_access arrays.

**Identifier Options:**

Login as Super Admin using dynamic identifier.

**Identifier Options:**

- Username: superadmin

Get current user's profile including user_code and user_role fields.

item.description:
Quick start endpoints for testing. Run steps 1-4 to test the complete registration flow.

**New User Registration Flow:**
1. Register ‚Üí 2. Verify Email OTP ‚Üí 3. Verify Phone OTP ‚Üí 4. Login

**Test Accounts:**
- Developer: dev@credbuzz.com / Developer@123 (CGX0R0)
- Super Admin: superadmin@credbuzz.com / SuperAdmin@123 (VYO541)

item.name: üîê Authentication

request.description:
Register a new user account.

**Required Fields:**
- first_name, last_name, email, phone_number, password, confirm_password

**Optional Fields:**
- middle_name

**After Registration:**
- OTPs sent to email AND phone
- User must verify both before login (for END_USER role)
- test_otps returned in response for development testing

**User is assigned:**
- user_role: END_USER (default)
- user_code: Auto-generated 6-character unique code

Verify Email OTP after registration.

**otp_type options:**
- EMAIL: Verify email address
- PHONE: Verify phone number

Verify Phone OTP after registration.

**Note:** END_USER must verify BOTH email and phone before login.

Resend OTP for registration verification.

**otp_type options:**
- EMAIL: Resend email OTP
- PHONE: Resend phone OTP

**Dynamic Login** - Single identifier field auto-detects login type.

**identifier field accepts:**
- Email: user@example.com (contains @)
- Phone: +1234567890 (starts with +)
- User Code: ABC123 (6 alphanumeric chars)
- Username: johndoe (default)

**Response includes:**
- app_access: Array of app IDs user can access
- feature_access: Array of feature IDs user can access
- session.inactivity_timeout_minutes: 30 min timeout

**Security:**
- 5 failed attempts ‚Üí progressive lockout
- 30 min inactivity ‚Üí auto logout
Logout and invalidate current session.
Get a new access token using the refresh token.
Request a password reset token.
Reset password using the reset token.
Get the authenticated user's basic profile.

Get comprehensive profile including:
- User details (name, email, phone, verification status)
- KYC status (application_id, status, mega_step, current_step, completion %)
- App access (apps user can access with permissions)
- Feature access (features user can access with permissions)
Update the authenticated user's profile.

item.description: User authentication endpoints including registration, login, logout, and password management.

item.name: üë• Users Management

request.description: Get list of all active users (excludes soft-deleted users by default).
Get list of all users including soft-deleted ones.
Get list of only soft-deleted users.
Get details of a specific user (only active users, not soft-deleted).
Update a user's information.
Update a user's role. Valid roles: DEVELOPER, SUPER_ADMIN, ADMIN, CLIENT, END_USER. Requires Admin+ permission.
Search users by email, username, first_name, last_name, or user_code.

**SOFT DELETE** - Marks user as deleted (is_deleted=True) without removing from database.

- Sets is_deleted=True
- Sets is_active=False
- Records deleted_at timestamp
- Invalidates all sessions
- User can be restored later

**Note:** Cannot delete your own account.

**HARD DELETE** - Permanently removes user from database.

‚ö†Ô∏è **WARNING:** This action CANNOT be undone!

- Completely removes user record
- Removes all related data (sessions, login attempts, etc.)
- User cannot be recovered

**Note:** Cannot delete your own account.

**RESTORE** - Restores a soft-deleted user.

- Sets is_deleted=False
- Sets is_active=True
- Clears deleted_at timestamp
- User can login again
Activate a deactivated user account.
Deactivate a user account (different from delete - just sets is_active=False).

item.description: User management CRUD operations including soft delete, hard delete, and restore.

item.name: üìä User Activity Logs

request.description:
Get all user activity logs. Requires Admin+ role.

**Activity Types:**
- LOGIN, LOGOUT
- PROFILE_UPDATE
- PASSWORD_CHANGE, PASSWORD_RESET
- KYC_SUBMIT, KYC_APPROVED, KYC_REJECTED
- ACCOUNT_LOCKED, ACCOUNT_UNLOCKED
Get activity logs for a specific user.
Get activity logs filtered by activity type.

item.name: Filter Activity Logs by Date Range

request.description: Get activity logs within a date range.
Get current user's activity logs. Available to all authenticated users.
Get current user's activity logs with filters.

item.description: User activity logging endpoints. Track user actions like login, logout, profile updates, KYC submissions, etc.

item.name: üîê Access Management

request.description:
Get complete list of all apps, features, and roles for access assignment.

**Use Case:** SP/Developer uses this to see all available access items before assigning to Admin/Client users.

**Returns:**
- apps: List of all apps with their features
- roles: List of all roles
- total_apps, total_features, total_roles counts

Get comprehensive access overview for a specific user.

**Returns:**
- user: Basic user info
- roles: Assigned roles with timestamps
- apps: Apps user can access with permissions
- features: Features user can access with permissions
- kyc_status: User's KYC application status

Assign role, apps, and/or features to a user.

**All fields are optional:**
- role_code: Assign a role (will update user.user_role)
- app_codes: Array of app codes to grant access
- feature_codes: Array of feature codes to grant access

**Permissions:**
- Only can assign roles at or below your level
- Super Admin/Developer only
Assign only a role to a user.
Assign only apps to a user.

Revoke specific access from a user.

**Options:**
- role_code: Revoke a specific role
- app_codes: Revoke specific app access
- feature_codes: Revoke specific feature access
- revoke_all: true - Revoke ALL access
Revoke ALL access from a user (all roles, apps, features).

item.description:
Access management endpoints for SP/Developer to assign and revoke access to users.

**Workflow:**
1. Use 'Get All Apps & Features' to see available items
2. Use 'Get User Access Overview' to see current user access
3. Use 'Assign Access' to grant new access
4. Use 'Revoke Access' to remove access

request.description: List all KYC applications. Requires DEVELOPER, SUPER_ADMIN, or SUPPORT role.

query.description: Filter: NOT_STARTED, IN_PROGRESS, SUBMITTED, UNDER_REVIEW, APPROVED, REJECTED

request.description: List KYC applications with filters.

query.description: Search by email, user_code, or application_id

request.description: Search KYC applications by email, user code, or application ID.
Get detailed view of a KYC application including all proofs, documents, and audit logs.
Mark application as under review. Changes status from SUBMITTED to UNDER_REVIEW.
Approve KYC application. Optional remarks can be added.
Reject KYC application. Rejection reason is required and shown to the user.

item.description: Admin endpoints for reviewing and managing KYC applications. Requires admin role (DEVELOPER, SUPER_ADMIN, SUPPORT).

KYC (Know Your Customer) verification endpoints for user onboarding.

## KYC Flow
1. **Start KYC** - Initialize application
2. **OTP Verification** - Verify email/phone (optional)
3. **Identity Proof** - Submit Aadhaar and PAN details with photos
4. **Business Details** - Submit business information and address
5. **Verification Images** - Upload selfie, office photos, address proof
6. **Bank Details** - Submit bank account information
7. **Submit** - Submit for admin review

## Status Flow
```
NOT_STARTED ‚Üí IN_PROGRESS ‚Üí SUBMITTED ‚Üí UNDER_REVIEW ‚Üí APPROVED/REJECTED
```

## Security
- Aadhaar, PAN, Account numbers are encrypted
- Responses show masked values (XXXX-XXXX-9012)
- Max file size: 5MB
- Allowed formats: JPG, PNG, PDF
